summary: Interactive app for Phuba Government High School
architectural_notes: PWA implementation required: manifest.json, service worker, and installability features
Role-based access control required for different user types (students, teachers, parents, administrators)
Photo upload and storage system needed for galleries and teacher profiles
Payment gateway integration required for fee payment system
Poumai poems section requires text storage and display with support for both Poumai language and optional English translations

existing_features.title: Create a welcome homepage that displays the school name 'Phuba Government High School' with a hero section introducing the interactive features of the app
Implement a student directory section where users can view a list of students with basic information (name, class, student ID)
Create an announcements section where school administrators can post and view announcements with title, content, and timestamp
Implement a class schedule viewer that displays different class schedules organized by grade or section
Create an events calendar section showing upcoming school events with date, time, and description

Apply a cohesive educational theme with warm, welcoming colors (such as green and gold or navy and white), clear typography suitable for an academic environment, and a professional yet approachable layout that works well for students, teachers, and parents

Create a Web App Manifest file (frontend/public/manifest.json) with app metadata including name 'Phuba Government High School', short_name 'Phuba GHS', description, theme_color matching the navy primary color from the existing theme, background_color, display mode 'standalone', and icons array with multiple sizes (192x192, 512x512) for app icons
Link the manifest file in frontend/index.html by adding a <link rel='manifest' href='/manifest.json'> tag in the head section

Create a service worker file (frontend/public/sw.js) that implements caching strategies for offline functionality, caches static assets (HTML, CSS, JS, images), and provides a basic offline fallback experience

Add appropriate meta tags to frontend/index.html for PWA support including viewport, theme-color matching the navy primary color, apple-mobile-web-app-capable, and apple-mobile-web-app-status-bar-style

Create a photo gallery frontend page with category filtering (general, events, achievements, facilities), grid display of photos with titles and descriptions, and an admin interface for uploading new photos with form fields for title, description, category, and image file upload. Display photos as static assets in frontend/public/assets/photos.

Create a teacher profiles frontend page displaying teacher cards in a grid layout with photo, name, subjects taught, qualifications, contact info, and office hours. Add an admin interface for creating and editing teacher profiles with a form including all required fields.

Create an exam results frontend page where students see their own exam results displayed in a table with columns for exam name, subject, grade, percentage, date, and remarks. Add an admin interface for entering and managing exam results with a form for all result fields and student selection.

Create a library management frontend page with a book catalog displaying books in a searchable table with title, author, category, and availability. Show students their borrowing history with due dates and return status. Add an admin interface for adding books, managing inventory, and processing borrow/return transactions.

Create a fee payment frontend page where students see their outstanding fees, payment history, and total balance in a clear dashboard layout. Display fees in a table with fee type, amount, due date, paid amount, and status. Add an admin interface for creating fees, recording payments with amount and payment method, and viewing financial reports.

Create a contact page with a public contact form including fields for name, email, subject, and message. Add an admin contact messages inbox page displaying all submitted messages in a table with sender info, subject, timestamp, and status, with the ability to mark messages as read or replied.

Update the Layout component navigation menu to include links to all new sections: Photo Gallery, Teachers, Exam Results, Library, Fees, and Contact. Ensure navigation items are styled consistently with the existing navy and gold educational theme.

Create a frontend Poumai Poems page (frontend/src/pages/PoumaiPoemsPage.tsx) displaying a collection of Poumai poems in a grid layout with category/theme filtering capability. Each poem card should display: title, author, poem text (with appropriate formatting for line breaks), date written, category/theme, and optional English translation with cultural/historical context.

Create an admin interface within the Poumai Poems page for managing poems. Include a dialog form with fields for title, author, poem text (textarea with line break support), date written (date picker), category (dropdown or text input), optional English translation (textarea), and optional cultural context (textarea). Implement add, edit, and delete functionality accessible only to admin users.

Add a 'Poumai Poems' navigation link to the Layout component (frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx) navigation menu. Style the link consistently with existing navigation items using the navy and gold educational theme. Add the route configuration to App.tsx with path '/poumai-poems'.

Create React Query hooks in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts for Poumai poems operations: usePoems (fetch all poems), usePoemsByCategory (fetch poems by category), useCreatePoem (create new poem), useUpdatePoem (update existing poem), and useDeletePoem (delete poem). Ensure proper query invalidation after mutations.

new_feature_requests.summary: Add PWA (Progressive Web App) functionality with 'Add to Home Screen' capability
Register the service worker in frontend/src/main.tsx after the React app mounts, checking for service worker support and handling registration lifecycle events (success, error)
Implement photo galleries with categories (general, events, achievements, facilities) and admin upload/management capabilities
Create teacher profiles section with name, subjects taught, qualifications, contact info, photo, and office hours
Build exam results portal for students to view their grades
Implement library management system for tracking books and borrowing
Create fee payment system for tuition and other payments
Add contact forms for communication with the school

Create a photo gallery system with four categories: general school photos, events, achievements, and facilities. Implement backend data models and CRUD operations for storing photo records with fields for title, description, category, imageUrl, uploadedBy, and timestamp.

Create a teacher profiles system with backend data models and CRUD operations for storing teacher records with fields for name, subjects (array), qualifications, contactInfo, photoUrl, and officeHours.

Create an exam results portal with backend data models for storing exam records with fields for studentId, examName, subject, grade, percentage, examDate, and remarks. Implement CRUD operations with role-based access where students can only view their own results and administrators can manage all results.

Create a library management system with backend data models for books (title, author, isbn, category, availableCopies, totalCopies) and borrowing records (bookId, studentId, borrowDate, dueDate, returnDate, status). Implement CRUD operations for books and borrowing records with role-based access where students can view books and their borrowing history, and administrators can manage books and all borrowing records.

Create a fee payment system with backend data models for fee records (studentId, feeType, amount, dueDate, paidAmount, paidDate, status, description) and payment transactions (feeId, studentId, amount, paymentDate, paymentMethod, transactionId). Implement CRUD operations where students can view their fee obligations and payment history, and administrators can manage fees and record payments.

Create a contact form system with backend data models for storing contact messages with fields for senderName, senderEmail, subject, message, timestamp, status (new/read/replied), and optional studentId for authenticated users. Implement operations where anyone can submit contact forms and administrators can view and manage all messages.

Create a Poumai Poems section integrated into the website with frontend page displaying poem collection in grid layout with category/theme filtering and individual poem cards showing title, author, poem text, date written, category, and optional English translation with cultural context

Implement backend data models and CRUD operations for Poumai poems with fields for title, author, poemText, dateWritten, category, englishTranslation, culturalContext, and role-based access (public viewing, admin management)
Create admin interface for managing Poumai poems with forms for adding, editing, and deleting poems with all required fields
Add 'Poumai Poems' navigation link to existing menu styled consistently with navy and gold educational theme

Implement backend Motoko data models and CRUD operations for Poumai poems in backend/main.mo. Create a Poem type with fields: id (Nat), title (Text), author (Text), poemText (Text), dateWritten (Text), category (Text), englishTranslation (?Text), culturalContext (?Text), createdBy (Principal), and timestamp (Int). Implement functions: createPoem (admin only), updatePoem (admin only), deletePoem (admin only), getPoem (public), listPoems (public), and listPoemsByCategory (public).
